key_work.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018) Mrs Hester Appleyard's burgundy picnic costume
key_work.brief_description: In Picnic at Hanging Rock (2018), Mrs Hester Appleyard (Natalie Dormer) appears exactly as she wishes to be seen: a proper lady, overseeing the social and intellectual development of her students. But even here, the story’s ominous undertones are foreshadowed. While Appleyard’s structured dresses hint at the strictness she exerts over her image, she’s also consistently dressed in darker colours than the other women. If this was an attempt to fade into the background as an unremarkable widow, it fails. If the girls’ white picnic dresses are ethereal, the headmistress’ silhouette and colour scheme is foreboding, giving a glimpse into the shadowy spectre of her past.

end.title: Cruella
end.creator_credit: Craig Gillespie, Jenny Beavan, Andrew Gunn, Glenn Close, Jared leboff, Kristin Burr, Marc Platt, Gunn Films, Marc Platt Productions, Walt Disney Pictures, Fiona Crombie, Dana Fox, Tony McNamara, Aline Brosh McKenna, Kelly Marcel and Steve Zissis
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2021
end.brief_description: In 1970s London amidst the punk rock revolution, a young grifter named Estella is determined to make a name for herself with her designs. She befriends a pair of young thieves who appreciate her appetite for mischief, and together they are able to build a life for themselves on the London streets. One day, Estella’s flair for fashion catches the eye of the Baroness von Hellman, a fashion legend who is devastatingly chic and terrifyingly haute. But their relationship sets in motion a course of events and revelations that will cause Estella to embrace her wicked side and become the raucous, fashionable and revenge-bent Cruella.
